Summarize an Object for Different Groups with by Variable

t_summary_by.Rd

This is a wrapper around the basic t_summary functions with the difference that it has a row_by argument. The row_by argument can either be a "by" object or it can be a "r_by" object in which case each list item is interpreted recursively as is typical for the terms item in t_events_term_grade_id.

t_summary_by(
  x,
  row_by,
  col_by,
  col_N = NULL,
  total = NULL,
  ...,
  table_tree = FALSE
)

Arguments

x

vector
row_by

a factor of length nrow(x) with no missing values. The levels of by define the summary sub-groups in the table.
col_by

a factor of length nrow(x) with no missing values. The levels of col_by define the columns in the table.
col_N

a vecor with the reference population per level of col_by. This often by default get_N(col_by). Names of the list are ignored, they are added in the order they appear.
total

string of column name of an added total column using by_add_total to col_by and col_N_add_total to col_N. If NULL no total column is added.
...

arguments passed on to methods
table_tree

logical, if FALSE then a single rtable gets returned, if TRUE a node object gets returned with the elementary rtable objects.

Details

For every level of the variable by a summary table using t_summary will be created. The individual tables are then stacked together.

See also

t_summary, t_summary.data.frame, t_summary.numeric, t_summary.factor, t_summary.logical, t_summary.Date, t_summary.character

Examples

library(dplyr)
library(random.cdisc.data)

ADSL <- radsl(cached = TRUE)

t_summary_by(
 x = ADSL$SEX,
 row_by = ADSL$COUNTRY,
 col_by = ADSL$ARMCD,
 total = "All Patients",
 drop_levels = TRUE
)
#>                              ARM A               ARM B               ARM C            All Patients
#>                             (N=134)             (N=134)             (N=132)             (N=400)   
#> --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> CHN
#>   n                            74                  81                  64                 219     
#>   F                       44 (59.46%)         45 (55.56%)         29 (45.31%)         118 (53.88%)
#>   M                       27 (36.49%)         35 (43.21%)         30 (46.88%)         92 (42.01%) 
#>   U                         2 (2.7%)           1 (1.23%)           3 (4.69%)           6 (2.74%)  
#>   UNDIFFERENTIATED         1 (1.35%)               0               2 (3.12%)           3 (1.37%)

ADSL$SEX[1:5] <- NA

t_summary_by(
 x = ADSL$SEX,
 row_by = ADSL$COUNTRY,
 col_by = ADSL$ARMCD,
 total = "All Patients",
 drop_levels = TRUE,
 useNA = "ifany"
)

ADQS <- radqs(cached = TRUE)
ADQS_f <- ADQS %>%
  dplyr::filter(PARAMCD=="BFIALL")

t_summary_by(
 x = ADQS_f$AVAL,
 row_by = ADQS_f$AVISIT,
 col_by = by_all("All"),
 col_N = nrow(ADSL),
)
#>                           All     
#>                         (N=400)

ADQS_f$AVALCAT1 <- factor(ifelse(ADQS_f$AVAL >= 50, "Positive", "Negative"),
  levels = c("Positive", "Negative"))
ADQS_f <- var_relabel(ADQS_f, AVALCAT1 = "Result" )

t_summary_by(
 x = ADQS_f$AVALCAT1,
 row_by = ADQS_f$AVISIT,
 col_by = ADQS_f$ARMCD,
 total = "All Patients",
 col_N = table(ADSL$ARMCD),
)

ADSL <- radsl(cached = TRUE)
ADLB <- radlb(cached = TRUE)

# Recursive case
t_summary_by(
  x = ADLB$AVAL,
  row_by = r_by(ADLB[, c("PARAM", "AVISIT")]),
  col_by = ADLB$ARM,
  col_N = table(ADSL$ARM),
  total = "All Patients"
)

# Table Tree
ADSL <- radsl(cached = TRUE)

tbls <- t_summary_by(
 x = ADSL$SEX,
 row_by = ADSL$COUNTRY,
 col_by = ADSL$ARMCD,
 total = "All Patients",
 table_tree = TRUE
)
summary(tbls)
#>                index            content             dim            hide label          format  
#> -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> root                              NULL                                TRUE                     
#>   CHN            1               rtable            5 x 4             FALSE                     
#>   USA            2               rtable            5 x 4             FALSE                     
#>   BRA            3               rtable            5 x 4             FALSE                     
#>   PAK            4               rtable            5 x 4             FALSE                     
#>   NGA            5               rtable            5 x 4             FALSE                     
#>   RUS            6               rtable            5 x 4             FALSE                     
#>   JPN            7               rtable            5 x 4             FALSE                     
#>   GBR            8               rtable            5 x 4             FALSE                     
#>   CAN            9               rtable            5 x 4             FALSE                     
to_rtable(tbls)
#>                              ARM A               ARM B               ARM C            All Patients
#>                             (N=134)             (N=134)             (N=132)             (N=400)   
#> --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> CHN
#>   n                            74                  81                  64                 219     
#>   F                       44 (59.46%)         45 (55.56%)         29 (45.31%)         118 (53.88%)
#>   M                       27 (36.49%)         35 (43.21%)         30 (46.88%)         92 (42.01%) 
#>   U                         2 (2.7%)           1 (1.23%)           3 (4.69%)           6 (2.74%)  
#>   UNDIFFERENTIATED         1 (1.35%)               0               2 (3.12%)           3 (1.37%)  
#> 
#> USA
#>   n                            10                  13                  17                  40     
#>   F                         7 (70%)            8 (61.54%)         10 (58.82%)          25 (62.5%) 
#>   M                         3 (30%)            5 (38.46%)          7 (41.18%)          15 (37.5%) 
#>   U                            0                   0                   0                   0      
#>   UNDIFFERENTIATED             0                   0                   0                   0      
#>

# Other examples
ADQS <- radqs(ADSL, seed = 2) %>%
  mutate(PARAM = as.factor(PARAM)) %>%
  var_relabel(
    PARAM = "Questionnaire Parameter",
    AVISIT = "Visit"
  )

# we suppress warnings because some are NaN (change CHG at screening visit)
suppressWarnings(t_summary_by(
  x = ADQS[,c("AVAL", "CHG")],
  row_by = r_by(ADQS[, c("PARAM", "AVISIT")]),
  col_by = ADQS$ARMCD,
  col_N = table(ADSL$ARMCD),
  total = "All Patients"
))

ADQS_f <- ADQS %>%
  dplyr::filter(PARAMCD == "BFIALL") %>%
  dplyr::mutate(
    AVALCAT1 = factor(
      ifelse(AVAL >= 50, "Positive", "Negative"),
      levels = c("Positive", "Negative")
    )
  ) %>%
  var_relabel(
    AVALCAT1 = "Result",
    AVISIT = "Visit"
  )

t_summary_by(
  x = ADQS_f %>% select(c("AVALCAT1", "AVAL")),
  row_by = ADQS_f$AVISIT,
  col_by = ADQS_f$ARMCD,
  col_N = table(ADSL$ARMCD),
  total = "All Patients"
)
